Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Causal \Caus"al\, n. A causal word or form of speech. [1913 Webster]
Anglo-Saxon drencan to drench, causal of Anglo-Saxon drincan to drink. --Skeat. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Causal \Caus"al\, a. [L. causalis. See {Cause}.] Relating to a cause or causes; inplying or containing a cause or causes; expressing a cause; causative. [1913 Webster]
Causal propositions are where two propositions are joined by causal words. --Watts. [1913 Webster]
causal adj : involving or constituting a cause; causing; "a causal relationship between scarcity and higher prices"
